item.title: [Snippet]Server Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

[quote=“MagicPkz, post:5, topic:451753”]Don’t use “AND”, use &&.

Also, why are these two things strings?

$port = "43594"; $timeout = "10";[/quote]

The timeout is just a lil extra. Some use port 5555 when they are running multiple worlds so you can just set what port you use to connect.

wildskiller:

How can you use java with php?

What do you mean, this just pings the server to see if it can connect to it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Snippet]Server Status Checker
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

I was bored.

Basic port query script, you will just need to add your ip and off you go!
NOTE: This is not a tutorial.

[code]<?php

$server = “127.0.0.1”;
$port = “43594”;
$timeout = “10”;

if ($server and $port and $timeout) {
$server1 = @fsockopen("$server", $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
}
if($server1) {
echo “YOURSERVER is Online!”;
}
else {
echo “YOURSERVER is Offline!”;
}
?>[/code]

As I said, This is basic code meant for you to start with and make it look good.
You could completely integrate this with your website template/design.

Below are some basic things you can do with it.

If you want to use an image use this:

[code]<?php

$server = “127.0.0.1”;
$port = “43594”;
$timeout = “10”;

if ($server and $port and $timeout) {
$server1 = @fsockopen("$server", $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
}
if($server1) {
echo “”;
}
else {
echo “”;
}
?>[/code]

If you want to use colors use this:

[code]<?php

$server = “127.0.0.1”;
$port = “43594”;
$timeout = “10”;

if ($server and $port and $timeout) {
$server1 = @fsockopen("$server", $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
}
if($server1) {
echo “YOURSERVER is Online!”;
}
else {
echo “YOURSERVER is Offline!”;
}
?>[/code]

Read full topic
